intro: Rawsonia ugandensis, commonly known as the Uganda rawsonia, is a flowering plant native to the grasslands of East Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. It is adapted to dry environments and plays a role in soil stabilization and as a food source for local fauna.
